div.p: is hosted on Sourceforge. All the files and also the CVS tree can be downloaded (or checked out) from there.

The downloadable files are called pfixcore-<TYPE>-<VERSION>.<SUFFIX>. This naming scheme was choosen because a whole system always contains your own application classes and logic which use the core classes and utilities supplied by pfixcore. The files to download are shown in the table below.

td.p: This tar file contains a skeleton directory structure with all the things you need to start a new pustefix project. The pfixcore.jar and pfixcore-data.tar.gz files mentioned below are already contained in the file in the version indicated by the VERSION string.

If you don't already have a running pustefix project, start by downloading this file. For further updates, it's sufficiant to download new pfixcore.jar and pfixcore-data.tar.gz files to replace the ones you have currently in your project.

tr.td: This jar file contains all java classes that the core system needs. Download this file (and the corresponding pfixcore-data.tar.gz file) if you want to update an already running project.
This tar file contains all the XML/XSLT files that are needed by the core system. Download this file (and the corresponding pfixcore.jar file) if you want to update an already running project.

div.p: Please follow the instructions on the Sourceforge CVS page if you want to download the source repository for . The name of the repository is pfixcore.
